content: The PR #25304 (and its dependency #25562) received their last round of comments just before the switch to the PR-from-forks workflow. Any chance that they can be merged without transitioning them to a fork? I think @Michael Rothgang was looking at them last.
Thanks for the reminder! It's too easy for pull requests to get forgotten about (which is unfortunate, and hopefully this will get better in the near future), to asking again is appreciated.
#25562 looks good to me, except for a merge conflict. Can you merge master and still push? (I suspect not.)
If not, can you merge master and migrate the PR to a fork? Or would you prefer if I migrate it for you?

I do expect that #25304 will eventually need to move to a fork: it's very rare for a 200-300 line PR to receive no review comments (even for the expert Lean users), and my understanding is that PRs which require new commits need to be migrated to a fork.

Michael Rothgang said:

#25562 looks good to me, except for a merge conflict. Can you merge master and still push? (I suspect not.)

OK, I'll see what I can do later today.

Michael Rothgang said:

#25562 looks good to me, except for a merge conflict. Can you merge master and still push? (I suspect not.)

OK, I've created a corresponding PR from a fork: #26273

The only update so far is that I've merged in master. Hopefully the CI will not complain about anything. I'll migrate the main PR once I'm sure this migration has gone smoothly.
Thanks for the quick work on dependency! It is now already merged.

Michael Rothgang said:

I do expect that #25304 will eventually need to move to a fork: it's very rare for a 200-300 line PR to receive no review comments (even for the expert Lean users), and my understanding is that PRs which require new commits need to be migrated to a fork.

Now I have also migrated the main PR to the new workflow. The new one has the nice round number #26300. :) It is not blocked by dependency PRs and is ready for more comments.

I've run into a strange CI error and it's not clear to me whether it has anything to do with my code (locally I get no compilation errors). Here's the point where an error code appears:

Run lake build --no-build Mathlib
  lake build --no-build Mathlib
  lake build --no-build Archive
  lake build --no-build Counterexamples
  shell: /usr/bin/bash -e {0}
  env:
    LAKE_NO_CACHE: true
Error: Process completed with exit code 3.

I've tried merging in master a couple of times at intervals, but that doesn't seem to help.

Could it be a problem with the new PR workflow?
I think this is a known issue with the current workflow --- so you can ignore this error for now.
Merging with a recent enough master finally fixed the CI error. The #26300 now builds fine if anyone was waiting for that to make further comments.
